basics.name: Michal Wrobel
basics.label: Senior (Data|Backend|.*)? Developer
basics.summary: I'm a polyglot, full-stack developer with experience leading small teams. I've been working in many projects across different tech stacks and business units. That helped me to develop a good sense of what it takes to deliver a product and lower the maintenance costs. My focus is on adding value through quick iterations and validate different hypotheses. Since 2017 I'm fully remote and working with global teams in the UK and the United States. I'm organized, dedicated and easygoing.

highlights: Leads management system that uses ML lead scores to prioritize calls. [Scala, Kafka Streams, Docker]
API service to expose customer's behavioural data. [Kotlin, Spring Boot, Open API]
SMS rules service that enabled quick AB tests and sending texts. [Scala, Kafka Streams]
work.summary: I develop and architect various systems in Data and CRM space. I help teams to achieve tech and business objectives

highlights: Identity stitching and sessionzation services to unify analysis of unauthenticated users [Scala, Spark, AKKA-HTTP]
Provision Kafka cluster for production use. [cloudformation, puppet]
Architect and deliver CDC and Events pipelines on top of Kafka. Creating client libraries to integrate with kafka. [Scala, Ruby, AWS services]
work.summary: Working full time as an engineer in the data team. Working with Redshift, Airflow, Spark, Kafka, Scala and Ruby.

highlights: Integrating Snowplow Framework to collect data. [Scala, Ruby, Redshift, AWS EMR]
Architecting and maintaining project for data imports and exports. [Ruby, S3, Redshift]
work.summary: Working on the deployment platform built on top of AWS, Cloudformation and Puppet. Working closely with data team on provisioning Redshift and Snowplow framework

highlights: Service to generate PDF documents from HTML templates. Introducing docker containers. [Python]
Changing core data models, introducing in-flight migration framework. [Ruby, Rails]
